thread.title: Shah Rukh Khan: AbRam learnt to play with cars from Rohit Shetty
thread.title_full: Shah Rukh Khan: AbRam learnt to play with cars from Rohit Shetty - Entertainment

author: IANS
title: Shah Rukh Khan: AbRam learnt to play with cars from Rohit Shetty
text:
Hyderabad:  Shah Rukh Khan says his two-and-half years old son AbRam never played with cars till the time he met filmmaker Rohit Shetty on the sets of 'Dilwale'.
Also read: A day on the sets of Rohit Shetty's 'Dilwale' in Hyderabad 

Shah Rukh Khan with son AbRam. File Pic 
"My son came here (shooting location at Ramoji Film City) for four days and he spent 25 minutes with Rohit and learnt to play with cars. He never ever played with cars in his life, but I was shocked to discover that he was playing with cars while I was talking to him during a video chat."
"I saw AbRam playing with small cars and I don't know from where he got the cars. I was so shocked because he never did aggressive things in his life so far," quipped the 49-year-old, who also has two teenage children - son Aryan and daughter Suhana - with wife Gauri.
Shah Rukh says that at such a young age, his youngest son is also aware about the names of the cars.
"He learnt how to play with cars from Rohit, and he is also aware about the names of the cars too," said the superstar, who is busy shooting his much anticipated film in Hyderabad.
Directed by Shetty and produced by Red Chillies Entertainment, "Dilwale" will see the magical pair of Shah Rukh and Kajol coming together again on the silver screen.
A dekko of that was given to the scribes invited to the set. Shah Rukh, along with other cast members of the film, offered a sneak peak into the film with a 20-minute video footage.
The team has been shooting the last leg of the film in Hyderabad for a month.
